facebook.summary:

q&a.title: Parker-Taylor formula in the $n=4$ simple case
q&a.summary:
I am trying to do ex. 2.23 of http://arxiv.org/pdf/1308.1697v2.pdf. 
I have chosen as reference spinors $q_1,q_2 = p_3$ and $q_3,q_4 = p_1$. 

Therefore if I compute $A^4[1^- 2^- 3^+ 4^+]$ the computation is reduced to

$A^4[1^- 2^- 3^+ 4^+] = \alpha \ (p_

q&a.title: SU(N) Yang-Mills $gg \to ggg$ scattering at tree level
